description.plain:
Hailing from Ann Arbor, Michigan, brothers Ayleo and Mateo Bowles (a.k.a. AYO and TEO) have been dancing and competing at dance since elementary school. Influenced by greats such as Michael Jackson, Usher, Missy Elliot and Chris Brown, the duo quickly developed their own unique brand of dancing and began to upload Youtube videos from their basement and living room.

Strictly through the power of social media, they began to gain mass appeal by creating “dance challenges”. Recognizing this as their main outlet, the younger of the brothers (Teo) created what has become an instant phenomenon and their moniker – “THE REVERSE“. Simply reversing the steps to some of world’s best dance crazes, their Reverse of the “Nae Nae” went viral overnight, on every posted outlet, and received over 150 MILLION VIEWS!

Kicked off with a number of pics and vids reposted by Chris Brown, the two are now rubbing elbows and sharing stages with the very people that influenced them the most. Most recently being invited and flown out to perform by Usher himself, the boys shared the 2016 BET Awards stage with the R&B phenom.

body.plain:
Hailing from Ann Arbor, Michigan, brothers Ayleo and Mateo Bowles (a.k.a. AYO and TEO) have been dancing and competing at dance since elementary school. Influenced by greats such as Michael Jackson, Usher, Missy Elliot and Chris Brown, the duo quickly developed their own unique brand of dancing and began to upload Youtube videos from their basement and living room.

Strictly through the power of social media, they began to gain mass appeal by creating “dance challenges”. Recognizing this as their main outlet, the younger of the brothers (Teo) created what has become an instant phenomenon and their moniker – “THE REVERSE“. Simply reversing the steps to some of world’s best dance crazes, their Reverse of the “Nae Nae” went viral overnight, on every posted outlet, and received over 150 MILLION VIEWS!

Kicked off with a number of pics and vids reposted by Chris Brown, the two are now rubbing elbows and sharing stages with the very people that influenced them the most. Most recently being invited and flown out to perform by Usher himself, the boys shared the 2016 BET Awards stage with the R&B phenom.

songs.full_title: Lit Right Now by Ayo & Teo
songs.title: Lit Right Now

description.plain: Ann Arbor, Mich. brothers Ayo & Teo scored a viral hit earlier this year with “Rolex,” which hit 14 million views on YouTube, and they’re looking replicate their success with their new song “Lit Right Now.” The song is produced by BL$$D, who also handled the beat for “Rolex.” The flow on the choruses is reminiscent of the song https://genius.com/Speaker-knockerz-lonely-lyrics by late artist Speaker Knockerz

songs.embed_content: Read “Lit Right Now” by Ayo & Teo on Genius

songs.full_title: Better Off Alone by Ayo & Teo
songs.title: Better Off Alone

description.plain: “Better Off Alone” by the dancing sensation brothers “Ayo & Teo” is the brothers' 4th single of their hip hop career. The song details a previous relationship that was influenced by money and riches rather than love. After leaving with lavish clothing and watches, the song details how the brothers believe they’re better off alone, rather than be in a relationship with a girl only influenced through materialistic things. The girl then hears how the brothers became famous and wants a relationship again, but she is denied because of her past of selfish love.

songs.embed_content: Read “Better Off Alone” by Ayo & Teo on Genius
